title: Structural Econometric Estimation of the Basic Reproduction Number for Covid-19 Across U.S. States and Selected Countries. (arXiv:2309.08619v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: This paper proposes a structural econometric approach to estimating the basic reproduction number ($\mathcal{R}_{0}$) of Covid-19. This approach identifies $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ in a panel regression model by filtering out the effects of mitigating factors on disease diffusion and is easy to implement. We apply the method to data from 48 contiguous U.S. states and a diverse set of countries. Our results reveal a notable concentration of $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ estimates with an average value of 4.5. Through a counterfactual analysis, we highlight a significant underestimation of the $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ when mitigating factors are not appropriately accounted for.

Title: Structural Econometric Estimation of the Basic Reproduction Number for Covid-19 Across U.S. States and Selected Countries. (arXiv:2309.08619v1 [econ.EM])
Abstract: This paper proposes a structural econometric approach to estimating the basic reproduction number ($\mathcal{R}_{0}$) of Covid-19. This approach identifies $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ in a panel regression model by filtering out the effects of mitigating factors on disease diffusion and is easy to implement. We apply the method to data from 48 contiguous U.S. states and a diverse set of countries. Our results reveal a notable concentration of $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ estimates with an average value of 4.5. Through a counterfactual analysis, we highlight a significant underestimation of the $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ when mitigating factors are not appropriately accounted for.
translated_title: 结构计量方法估计美国各州和选定国家COVID-19基本传染率
translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种结构计量方法来估计COVID-19的基本传染率$\mathcal{R}_{0}$。该方法通过从传染病传播的减轻因素中滤除效应，在面板回归模型中确定了$\mathcal{R}_{0}$，实施简单。我们将该方法应用于48个连续的美国州和多样化的国家的数据。我们的结果显示，$\mathcal{R}_{0}$估计呈现显著集中，平均值为4.5。通过对照分析，我们突出了在未适当考虑减轻因素时对$\mathcal{R}_{0}$的明显低估。
tldr: 本文提出了一种结构计量方法来估计COVID-19的基本传染率$\mathcal{R}_{0}$，结果显示平均值为4.5，而且当未适当考虑减轻因素时，$\mathcal{R}_{0}$估计会明显低估。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a structural econometric approach to estimate the basic reproduction number ($\mathcal{R}_{0}$) of Covid-19. The results reveal an average value of 4.5 for $\mathcal{R}_{0}$ estimates, and a significant underestimation when mitigating factors are not appropriately accounted for.
